segments.text: I see a woman drying dishes, completely unaware of the water overflowing from the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is already in the puddle, but she doesn’t even seem to notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children behind her are up to no good, climbing on that wobbly stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder how long it will take her to realize what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is reaching for cookies, and the stool looks like it’s about to tip over.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting for a cookie like it’s perfectly normal.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm everything looks outside the window while chaos unfolds inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring out, and she’s still polishing that plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think someone is going to get hurt if this keeps going.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene feels like a disaster waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR
